intro: Stenocalyx michelii var. rigida, commonly known as the rigid stenocalyx, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its dense, evergreen foliage and showy, tubular flowers. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 3 meters. Its flowers are usually pink or red, attracting pollinators such as birds and insects. The leaves are leathery and arranged in opposite pairs, contributing to its ornamental value in horticulture.
